org.fluidity.deployment.osgi

Interface BundleBoundary


  • public interface BundleBoundary
    Enables controlled cross-bundle class loading in an OSGi container. More specifically, this component allows:
    • import: allowing access by a remote component to classes in the calling bundle: useful when receiving a reference to an OSGi service that you want to be able to load classes from the calling bundle;
    • export: allowing a local component to access classes in the bundle that loaded another component: useful when sending to another bundle an OSGi service component that you want to be able to load classes from that other bundle.

    Usage

    Fluid Tool uses this component internally to inject an OSGi service as a dependency of a managed component. Manual use of this component would only be necessary if you don't use such managed components. 
     final BundleBoundary boundary = …;
 final BundleContext context = …;
 final ServiceReference<RemoteComponent> reference = context.getServiceReference(RemoteComponent.class);
 final RemoteComponent service = boundary.imported(RemoteComponent.class, context.getService(reference));

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> T exported(Class<T> type, Object remote, T local)
      Wraps the given local object to allow it to load classes from the bundle of the provided remote object.
      <T> T imported(Class<T> type, T remote)
      Wraps the given object from another bundle to allow it to find classes in the calling bundle.
      <T,E extends Exception>
      T      		 invoke(Object remote, Object local, Command.Process<T,E> command)
      Invokes the given command with a context class loader that allows the remote object to find classes from the bundle of the local object.

    • Method Detail

      • imported

        <T> T imported(Class<T> type,
               T remote)
        Wraps the given object from another bundle to allow it to find classes in the calling bundle.

        The given object must implement the given interface and the given interface must be represented at run time by the same class in both bundles; i.e., it must be exported by one bundle and imported by all others.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the given remote object to import.
        Parameters:
        type - the Java interface of the remote object.
        remote - the object from another bundle.
        Returns:
        the wrapped service.

      • exported

        <T> T exported(Class<T> type,
               Object remote,
               T local)
        Wraps the given local object to allow it to load classes from the bundle of the provided remote object. If the remote object is not known, the receiver of the local object must use the imported(Class, Object) method instead.

        The local object must implement the given interface and the given interface must be represented at run time by the same class in both bundles; i.e., it must be exported by one bundle and imported by all others.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the given local object to export.
        Parameters:
        type - the Java interface of the local object.
        remote - the remote object, the bundle of which the local object must be able to find classes in.
        local - the local object to be invoked by the client or any other object from its bundle.
        Returns:
        the wrapped local object.

      • invoke

        <T,E extends Exception> T invoke(Object remote,
                                 Object local,
                                 Command.Process<T,E> command)
                          throws Exceptions.Wrapper
        Invokes the given command with a context class loader that allows the remote object to find classes from the bundle of the local object. Any exception thrown by the command will be wrapped.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type of the command.
        E - the exception type thrown by the command.
        Parameters:
        remote - the remote object.
        local - the local object.
        command - the command to allow with the tunneling class loader.
        Returns:
        whatever the command returns.
        Throws:
        Exceptions.Wrapper - wraps all checked exceptions thrown by the method.
